content:
I'm getting 500 Internal Server Errors during IG publishing, when expanding value sets that include the NDC code system (http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/ndc).

I've tried a few variations and have found that the error occurs when including all codes from the code system, but not when limiting the value set to a specific code (specifying a concept within the ValueSet's include composite). I've attached the request and response for those scenarios, from the qa-tx.html
ndc-expansion-500-error-rtpbc-ig.txt

Is this something I'm causing?
Thanks
The FHIR terminology server seems to be unhappy, so probably not you.
That's what I was wondering. @Grahame Grieve Just letting you know this is occurring

Hi Grahame. I updated the publisher and retried. I'm afraid I'm still receiving the 500 error.
I see that the request to the server now has the excludeNested parameter set to 'true', but the error in the response is exactly the same as I was receiving Friday (Access violation at address 0000000000E97189 in module 'FHIRServer.exe'. Read of address 000000000000001C).
Just let me know if there's anything I can do to help troubleshoot.
sure - can you send your txlog.* from the output directory please

Hi Grahame. Here's the qa-tx.html file from the output directory. qa-tx.html
Just let me know if you need anything else
fixed next time I upgrade tx.fhir.org - thanks
